turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ministry of Justice of Georgia.
turn.1: What is the main function of the Ministry of Justice of Georgia?
turn.2: Ministry of Justice of Georgia The Ministry of Justice of Georgia (, "sakartvelos iustitsiis saministro") is a governmental agency within the Cabinet of Georgia in charge of regulating activities in the justice system, overseeing the public prosecutor, maintaining the legal system and public order, protection of the public and instituting law reforms in Georgia.
turn.3: Who is the head of the ministry?
turn.4: The ministry is headed by Tea Tsulukiani.
turn.5: When was the judicial system developed?
turn.6: The development of the judicial system in Georgia dates back to Pharnavazi era when legislative functions were regulated by the People's Assembly and the Council of Elders.
turn.7: What are the main points of the judicial system?
turn.8: In 9th-10th centuries, the system was assigned to a state body called "Darbazi" (Chamber) which included clergy, aristocracy and the commons.
turn.9: What are the duties of the Ministry of Justice?
turn.10: This institution was in charge of issuing important legal documents, such as "Samparavtmdzebnelo Law" (Criminal Law), "Bagrat Kurapalati Law", "Giorgi V Law", "Royal Court Regulations", as well as translation and adaptation of international documents such as Law of Moses, Greek and Roman-Syrian laws, etc.
turn.11: Is there anything else interesting about the judicial system?
turn.12: A single collection of old documents was preserved and saved during the reign of Vakhtang VI in the beginning of the 18th century.
